dt: {bc}something given or contributed voluntarily as due or deserved
{bc}a gift or service showing respect, gratitude, or affection
{bc}something (such as material evidence or a formal attestation) that indicates the worth, virtue, or effectiveness of the one in question

dt.t: the design is a {wi}tribute{/wi} to his ingenuity

dt: {bc}a payment by one ruler or nation to another in acknowledgment of submission or as the price of protection
{bc}the tax levied for such a payment
{bc}an excessive tax, rental, or tariff imposed by a government, sovereign, lord, or landlord
{bc}an exorbitant charge levied by a person or group having the power of coercion

pt: {sc}encomium{/sc} {sc}eulogy{/sc} {sc}panegyric{/sc} {sc}tribute{/sc} {sc}citation{/sc} mean a formal expression of praise. {sc}encomium{/sc} implies enthusiasm and warmth in praising a person or a thing.
{sc}eulogy{/sc} applies to a prepared speech or writing extolling the virtues and services of a person.

pt.t: delivered the {it}eulogy{/it} at the funeral service

pt: {sc}panegyric{/sc} suggests an elaborate often poetic compliment.

pt.t: her lyrical memoir was a {it}panegyric{/it} to her mentor

pt: {sc}tribute{/sc} implies deeply felt praise conveyed either through words or through a significant act.

pt.t: the concert was a musical {it}tribute{/it} to the early jazz masters

pt: {sc}citation{/sc} applies to the formal praise of a person offered in a military dispatch or in awarding an honorary degree.

et: Middle English {it}tribut{/it}, from Latin {it}tributum{/it}, from neuter of {it}tributus{/it}, past participle of {it}tribuere{/it} to allot, bestow, grant, pay, from {it}tribus{/it} tribe
shortdef: something given or contributed voluntarily as due or deserved; especially : a gift or service showing respect, gratitude, or affection
something (such as material evidence or a formal attestation) that indicates the worth, virtue, or effectiveness of the one in question
a payment by one ruler or nation to another in acknowledgment of submission or as the price of protection; also : the tax levied for such a payment
